meanings.definition: A person who operates a braille machine.
meanings.sent1: The brailler helped students read by transcribing books into braille.
meanings.sent2: The school hired a new brailler to assist visually impaired students.
meanings.sent3: The brailler made sure all the braille books were perfectly embossed.
meanings.sent4: She was a brailler, turning words into a tactile language for the blind.
meanings.sent5: The brailler's fingers danced across the braille paper, bringing stories to life.

meanings.definition: A machine used for writing in braille.
meanings.sent1: The brailler sat on the desk, ready to emboss messages in braille.
meanings.sent2: The teacher demonstrated how to use the brailler to create braille labels.
meanings.sent3: The brailler hummed softly as it embossed the braille alphabet onto paper.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet room, the brailler spoke volumes in the language of touch.
meanings.sent5: The brailler was a silent artist, crafting stories in raised dots for the blind to read.

meanings.definition: To write in braille using a braille machine.
meanings.sent1: She would brailler the notes for the blind student to read later.
meanings.sent2: The volunteers gathered to brailler the menus for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally braillered the wrong page, causing a mix-up in the document.
meanings.sent4: The author braillered her latest novel, bringing her words to a new audience.
meanings.sent5: As she braillered the message, she felt a sense of fulfillment in helping others access information.
